meanings.definition: To place or position after something else.
meanings.sent1: After finishing his meal, he enjoys postposing the dishes in the sink.
meanings.sent2: She always postposes her homework until the last minute.
meanings.sent3: The cat postposed its nap to chase after a butterfly.
meanings.sent4: The sun postposed its appearance, hiding behind the clouds.
meanings.sent5: Postposing the puzzle pieces made it easier to see the whole picture.

meanings.definition: To move or shift to a later position.
meanings.sent1: The meeting was postposed to next week due to scheduling conflicts.
meanings.sent2: He postposes his appointments when he's running late.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel postposed gathering nuts for a sunny day.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter postposed the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: Postposing the event allowed more people to attend.

meanings.sent1: They decided to postpose the trip until the weather improved.
meanings.sent2: The construction was postposed due to budget constraints.
meanings.sent3: The child postposed bedtime by asking for one more story.
meanings.sent4: His smile postposed her worries for a moment.
meanings.sent5: Postposing the decision led to unexpected consequences.
